member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ContentDirectionExtensions.ContentFromLeftToRight(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer)
member.summary: Sets the left-to-right (LTR) direction for its entire content. Learn more

remarks.para: This writing system is used by most of modern languages.

The content direction affects various layout structures. In LTR mode, items are typically aligned to the left. This mode also influences the direction of items in certain layouts. For instance, in a row element with LTR mode, the first item is positioned on the left, while the last item is on the right.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ContentDirectionExtensions.ContentFromRightToLeft(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer)
member.summary: Sets the right-to-left (RTL) direction for its entire content. Learn more

remarks.para: This writing system is used by languages such as Hebrew, Arabic, and Persian.

The content direction affects various layout structures. In RTL mode, items are typically aligned to the right. This mode also influences the direction of items in certain layouts. For instance, in a row element with RTL mode, the first item is positioned on the right, while the last item is on the left.

summary.para: Divides the container's space into three distinct sections: before, content, and after.
The "before" section is rendered above the main content, while the "after" section is rendered below it.
If the main "content" spans across multiple pages, both the "before" and "after" sections are consistently rendered on every page.

member.example: A typical use-case for this method is to render a table that spans multiple pages, with a consistent caption or header on each page.
member.param: The action to configure the content.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.DynamicComponentExtensions.Dynamic``1(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer,QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IDynamicComponent{``0})
member.summary: Represents a section of the document dynamically created based on its inner state. Components are page-aware, understand their positioning, can dynamically construct other content elements, and assess their dimensions, enabling complex layout creations. Learn more

example.para: Consider an invoice that presents all purchased items in a table format. Instead of just showing the final total price under the table, the requirement is to display the cumulative prices on each separate page.

Using the dynamic component, you can manually assemble the table, count how many items are visible on each page, calculate the price sum for items visible on each page, and then render the result under each sub-table.

member.remarks:
You can control the size of the Placeholder by chaining other elements before its invocation, e.g.:
.Width(200) .Height(100) .Placeholder("Sample text");
member.param: When provided, the placeholder displays this text. If omitted, a simple image icon is shown instead.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ElementExtensions.ShowOnce(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer)
member.summary: If the container spans multiple pages, its content appears only on the first one. Learn more

remarks.para: This element is useful if you wish to display a header on every page but want certain elements visible only on the first page.
Depending on the content, certain elements (such as Row or Table) may repeatedly draw their items across multiple pages. Use the ShowOnce element to modify this behavior if it's not desired.

example.para: Combine this element with SkipOnce to achieve more complex behaviors, e.g.:
.SkipOnce().ShowOnce() ensures the child element is displayed only on the second page.
.SkipOnce().SkipOnce() starts displaying the child element from the third page onwards.
.ShowOnce().SkipOnce() draws nothing, as the order of invocation is important.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ElementExtensions.SkipOnce(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer)
member.summary: If the container spans multiple pages, its content is omitted on the first page and then displayed on the second and subsequent pages. Learn more
member.remarks: A common use-case for this element is when displaying a consistent header across pages but needing to conditionally show/hide specific fragments on the first page.

example.para: Combine this element with ShowOnce to achieve more complex behaviors, e.g.:
.SkipOnce().ShowOnce() ensures the child element is displayed only on the second page.
.SkipOnce().SkipOnce() starts displaying the child element from the third page onwards.
.ShowOnce().SkipOnce() draws nothing, as the order of invocation is important.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ElementExtensions.ShowEntire(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer)
member.summary: Ensures its content is displayed entirely on a single page by disabling the default paging capability. Learn more

remarks.para: While many library elements inherently support paging, allowing content to span multiple pages, this element restricts that behavior.
Employ this when a single-page display is crucial.
Be cautious: its strict space constraints can trigger the if content exceeds the page's capacity.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ElementExtensions.EnsureSpace(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer,System.Single)

summary.para: Serves as a less-strict approach compared to the ShowEntire element.

It impacts only the very first page of its content's occurence. If the element fits within its first page, it's rendered as usual. However, if the element doesn't fit and the available space has less vertical space than required height, the content is entirely shifted to the next page.

member.remarks: This is especially useful for elements like tables, where you'd want to display several rows together. By setting the minHeight, you can avoid scenarios where only a single row appears at the page's end, ensuring a more cohesive presentation.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.DynamicImageDescriptor.WithRasterDpi(System.Int32)

summary.para: Specifies the DPI (dots-per-inch) for rasterizing images.
The target resolution is computed by multiplying the DPI with the physical image size on the document.
Higher DPI results in superior image quality but may increase the output file size.
Default DPI value is 288 DPI.

member.remarks: If the image has lower resolution that the one calculated from the DPI setting, it will NOT be rescaled.
member.example: Consider an image of dimensions 3x4 inches. Using a DPI value of 300, the final resolution translates to 900x1200 pixels.

summary.para: Controls the balance between encoding quality and file size.
Opaque images are JPEG-encoded based on this setting, while images with an alpha channel default to PNG format, disregarding this option.
Default is set to "high quality".

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ImageDescriptor.UseOriginalImage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When enabled, the library does not resize the image to achieve the target DPI, nor compress it with target image quality.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ImageDescriptor.WithRasterDpi(System.Int32)

summary.para: Specifies the DPI (dots-per-inch) for rasterizing images.
The target resolution is computed by multiplying the DPI with the physical image size on the document.
Higher DPI results in superior image quality but may increase the output file size.
Default DPI value is 288 DPI.

member.remarks: If the image has lower resolution that the one calculated from the DPI setting, it will NOT be rescaled.
member.example: Consider an image of dimensions 3x4 inches. Using a DPI value of 300, the final resolution translates to 900x1200 pixels.

summary.para: Controls the balance between encoding quality and file size.

member.summary: Combines the FitWidth and FitHeight settings. The image resizes itself to utilize all available space, preserving its aspect ratio. It will either fill the width or height based on the container's dimensions.
member.remarks: An optimal and safe choice.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ImageDescriptor.FitUnproportionally

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ImageExtensions.Image(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Draws an image by decoding it from a provided byte array. Learn more

remarks.para: Please note that there is a significant difference between image resolution (number of pixels vertically and horizontally) and its physical size described in points. Therefore, the resolution of an image is not used for determining its physical size on the document.

Multiple strategies exist for the Image element to determine its final size. By default, the image fills all the available width. This behavior can be customized using options within the descriptor class.
Images are automatically resized and compressed based on the descriptor's setup. It defaults to global document's settings.
Supported formats: PNG, JPEG and WEBP.

member.returns: Descriptor allowing adjustments to image attributes, such as scaling behavior, compression quality, and target DPI.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ImageExtensions.Image(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer,System.String)
member.summary: Draws the image loaded from a file located at the provided path. Learn more

remarks.para: Please note that there is a significant difference between image resolution (number of pixels vertically and horizontally) and its physical size described in points. Therefore, the resolution of an image is not used for determining its physical size on the document.

Multiple strategies exist for the Image element to determine its final size. By default, the image fills all the available width. This behavior can be customized using options within the descriptor class.
Images are automatically resized and compressed based on the descriptor's setup. It defaults to global document's settings.
Supported formats: PNG, JPEG and WEBP.

member.returns: Descriptor allowing adjustments to image attributes, such as scaling behavior, compression quality, and target DPI.

remarks.para: The order of code execution determines the drawing order:

If defined after the primary layer, it's drawn in front of the primary content (as a watermark).

Additional layers can also span multiple pages and are repeated on each one.

summary.para: For positive values, adds empty space around its content.
For negative values, pushes its content beyond the edges, increasing available space, similarly to negative HTML margins.
For positive values, adds empty space horizontally (left and right) around its content.
For negative values, pushes its content beyond the horizontal edges, increasing available space, similarly to negative HTML margins.
For positive values, adds empty space vertically (top and bottom) around its content.
For negative values, pushes its content beyond the vertical edges, increasing available space, similarly to negative HTML margins.
For positive values, adds empty space above its content.
For negative values, pushes its content beyond the top edge, increasing available space, similarly to negative HTML margins.
For positive values, adds empty space below its content.
For negative values, pushes its content beyond the bottom edge, increasing available space, similarly to negative HTML margins.
For positive values, adds empty space to the left of its content.
For negative values, pushes its content beyond the left edge, increasing available space, similarly to negative HTML margins.
For positive values, adds empty space to the right of its content.
For negative values, pushes its content beyond the right edge, increasing available space, similarly to negative HTML margins.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.DefaultTextStyle(System.Func{QuestPDF.Infrastructure.TextStyle,QuestPDF.Infrastructure.TextStyle})

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.ContentFromLeftToRight
member.summary: Applies a left-to-right (LTR) content direction to all elements within the page set. Learn more

remarks.para: This writing system is used by most of modern languages.

The content direction affects various layout structures. In LTR mode, items are typically aligned to the left. This mode also influences the direction of items in certain layouts. For instance, in a row element with LTR mode, the first item is positioned on the left, while the last item is on the right.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.ContentFromRightToLeft
member.summary: Applies a right-to-left (RTL) content direction to all elements within the page set. Learn more

remarks.para: This writing system is used by languages such as Hebrew, Arabic, and Persian.

The content direction affects various layout structures. In RTL mode, items are typically aligned to the right. This mode also influences the direction of items in certain layouts. For instance, in a row element with RTL mode, the first item is positioned on the right, while the last item is on the left.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.PageColor(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a background color of the page, which is white by default.
member.remarks: When working with file formats that support the alpha channel, it is possible to set the color to if necessary.
member.param: Color in a valid format (like #FF8800 for orange) or from the predefined set (like Colors.Red.Lighten1).

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.Background

member.remarks: Unaffected by the Margin configuration, it always occupies entire page.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.Foreground

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.Header
member.summary: Represents the segment at the very top of the page, just above the main content.
member.remarks: This container does not support paging capability. It's expected to be fully displayed on every page.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.Content
member.summary: Represents the primary content, located in-between the header and footer.
member.remarks: This container does support paging capability and determines the final lenght of the document.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.PageDescriptor.Footer
member.summary: Represents the section at the very bottom of the page, just below the main content.
member.remarks: This container does not support paging capability. It's expected to be fully displayed on every page.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.RowDescriptor.RelativeItem(System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the row element. This item occupies space proportionally to other relative items.
member.example: For a row element with a width of 100 points that has three items (a relative item of size 1, a relative item of size 5, and a constant item of size 10 points), the items will occupy sizes of 15 points, 75 points, and 10 points respectively.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.RowDescriptor.AutoItem
member.summary: Adds a new item to the row element. The size of this item adjusts based on its content.

remarks.para: The AutoItem requests as much horizontal space as its content requires.
It doesn't adjust its size based on other items and may frequently result in a .
It's recommended to use this API in conjunction with the MaxWidth element.

member.returns: The container of the newly created item.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.RowExtensions.Row(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer,System.Action{QuestPDF.Fluent.RowDescriptor})
member.summary:
Draws a collection of elements horizontally. Depending on the content direction mode, elements will be drawn from left to right, or from right to left.
Learn more

remarks.para: Supports paging.
Depending on its content, the Row element may repeatedly draw certain items across multiple pages. Use the ShowOnce element to modify this behavior if it's not desired.

member.param: The action to configure the row's content.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ScaleExtensions.Scale(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer,System.Single)
member.summary: Scales its inner content proportionally. Learn more

remarks.para: Although this adjustment modifies the space available to its inner content, some elements might use their own strategies to fill that space.
For example, an Image with the setting may retain its size, but its quality could vary based on the DPI setting.
In contrast, text will not only appear smaller or bigger; but also a different number of words may fit each line.

member.param: The scaling factor. Values greater than one enlarge the content, while values less than one reduce it.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ScaleExtensions.ScaleHorizontal(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer,System.Single)
member.summary: Scales the available horizontal space (along the X axis), causing content to appear expanded or squished, rather than simply larger or smaller. Learn more

remarks.para: Although this adjustment modifies the space available to its inner content, some elements might use their own strategies to fill that space.
For example, an Image with the setting may retain its size, but its quality could vary based on the DPI setting.
In contrast, text will not only appear smaller or bigger; but also a different number of words may fit each line.

member.param: The scaling factor. Values greater than one enlarge the content, while values less than one reduce it.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Fluent.ScaleExtensions.ScaleVertical(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer,System.Single)
member.summary: Scales the available vertical space (along the Y axis), causing content to appear expanded or squished, rather than simply larger or smaller. Learn more

remarks.para: Although this adjustment modifies the space available to its inner content, some elements might use their own strategies to fill that space.
For example, an Image with the setting may retain its size, but its quality could vary based on the DPI setting.
In contrast, text will not only appear smaller or bigger; but also a different number of words may fit each line.

member.param: The scaling factor. Values greater than one enlarge the content, while values less than one reduce it.

member.name: F:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.AspectRatioOption.FitWidth
member.summary: Adjusts content to occupy the full width available.
member.remarks: Used as the default setting in the library.

member.name: F:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.AspectRatioOption.FitHeight
member.summary: Adjusts content to fill the available height.
member.remarks: Often used with height-constraining elements such as: Height, MaxHeight, etc.

member.name: F:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.AspectRatioOption.FitArea
member.summary: Adjusts content to fill the available area while maintaining its aspect ratio. This may result in the content fully occupying either the width or height, depending on its dimensions.
member.remarks: Often used with constraining elements such as: Width, MaxWidth, Height, MaxHeight, etc.

member.name: F:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.ContentDirection.LeftToRight
member.summary: Sets the left-to-right (LTR) content direction. Learn more

remarks.para: This writing system is used by most of modern languages.

The content direction affects various layout structures. In LTR mode, items are typically aligned to the left. This mode also influences the direction of items in certain layouts. For instance, in a row element with LTR mode, the first item is positioned on the left, while the last item is on the right.

member.name: F:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.ContentDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: Sets the right-to-left (RTL) content direction. Learn more

remarks.para: This writing system is used by languages such as Hebrew, Arabic, and Persian.

The content direction affects various layout structures. In RTL mode, items are typically aligned to the right. This mode also influences the direction of items in certain layouts. For instance, in a row element with RTL mode, the first item is positioned on the right, while the last item is on the left.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.DocumentSettings.PdfA
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not make the document PDF/A-2b conformant. If true, include XMP metadata, a document UUID, and sRGB output intent information. This adds length to the document and makes it non-reproducable, but are necessary features for PDF/A-2b conformance.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.DocumentSettings.ImageCompressionQuality
member.summary: Encoding quality controls the trade-off between size and quality. When the image is opaque, it will be encoded using the JPEG format with the selected quality setting. When the image contains an alpha channel, it is always encoded using the PNG format and this option is ignored. The default value is "high quality".
member.remarks: This setting is taken into account only when the image is in the JPG format, otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.DocumentSettings.ImageRasterDpi
member.summary: The DPI (pixels-per-inch) at which images and features without native PDF support will be rasterized. A larger DPI would create a PDF that reflects the original intent with better fidelity, but it can make for larger PDF files too, which would use more memory while rendering, and it would be slower to be processed or sent online or to printer. When generating images, this parameter also controls the resolution of the generated content. Default value is 288.

member.name: T:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IComponent

summary.para: This interface represents a reusable document fragment.

Components serve as modular building blocks for abstracting document layouts. They promote code reusability across multiple sections or types of documents. Using a component, you can generate content based on its internal state.

member.example: Consider the scenario of a company-wide page header. Instead of replicating the same header design across various documents, a single component can be created and referenced wherever needed.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IComponent.Compose(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer)
member.summary: Method invoked by the library to compose document content.

member.name: T:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IContainer
member.summary: Represents a layout structure with exactly one child element.
member.remarks: The main purpose of this interface is to facilitate the Fluent API's construction. It's not intended to allow external creation of new container kinds or layout designs.

member.name: T:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IDocument
member.summary: Represents the document abstraction, including its content, metadata, and configuration settings. Learn more

remarks.para: Implement this interface to centralize your entire document's structure within a single class for easy management.
For a different approach, consider the Minimal API pathway.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IDocument.Compose(QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IDocumentContainer)
member.summary: Configures the document content by specifying its layout structure and visual element.
member.param: The document container used for defining content via the FluentAPI.

member.name: T:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IDocumentContainer
member.summary: Represents the primary container encapsulating the entire content of the document.

member.name: T:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.DynamicComponentComposeResult
member.summary: Represents the output from the DynamicComponent describing what should be rendered on the current page.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.DynamicComponentComposeResult.Content
member.summary: Any content created with the method that should be drawn on the currently rendered page.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.DynamicComponentComposeResult.HasMoreContent
member.summary: Set to true if the dynamic component has additional content for the next page. Set to false if all content from the dynamic component has been rendered.

member.name: T:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IDynamicComponent`1
member.summary: Represents a section of the document dynamically created based on its inner state. Components are page-aware, understand their positioning, can dynamically construct other content elements, and assess their dimensions, enabling complex layout creations.
member.remarks: Though dynamic components offer great flexibility, be cautious of potential performance impacts.
member.typeparam: Structure type representing the internal state of the component.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IDynamicComponent`1.State
member.summary: Represents the component's current state.

remarks.para: The state should remain read-only. Avoid direct state modifications. For any alterations, generate a new struct instance and reassign the State property.
Remember, the QuestPDF library can invoke the Compose method more than once for each page and might adjust the state internally.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IDynamicComponent`1.Compose(QuestPDF.Elements.DynamicContext)
member.summary: Method invoked by the library to plan and create new content for each page.
member.remarks: Remember, the QuestPDF library can invoke the Compose method more than once for each page and might adjust the state internally.
member.param: Context offering additional information (like current page number, entire document size) and the capability to produce dynamic content elements.
member.returns: Representation of content that should be placed on the current page.

member.name: T:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.IElement
member.summary:
Represents an element within the document content, for example:
- visual elements (text, image, canvas),
- positional elements (padding, aspect ratio),
- flow-control elements (page break, conditional displays),
- layout elements (table, column),
- and other element types (section, hyperlink, content direction).

member.name: T:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.Image

summary.para: Caches the image in local memory for efficient reuse.
Optimizes the generation process, especially:
- For images repeated in a single document to enhance performance and reduce output file size (e.g., an image used as list bullet icon).
- When an image appears on multiple document types for increased generation performance (e.g., a company logo).

member.remarks: This class is thread safe.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.Image.FromBinaryData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Loads the image from binary data. Learn more

remarks.para: Please note that there is a significant difference between image resolution (number of pixels vertically and horizontally) and its physical size described in points. Therefore, the resolution of an image is not used for determining its physical size on the document.

Multiple strategies exist for the Image element to determine its final size. By default, the image fills all the available width. This behavior can be customized using options within the descriptor class.
Images are automatically resized and compressed based on the descriptor's setup. It defaults to global document's settings.
Supported formats: PNG, JPEG and WEBP.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.ImageGenerationSettings.ImageFormat
member.summary: The file format used to encode the image(s).

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.ImageGenerationSettings.ImageCompressionQuality
member.summary: Encoding quality controls the trade-off between size and quality. The default value is "high".

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.ImageGenerationSettings.RasterDpi
member.summary: The DPI (pixels-per-inch) at which the document will be rasterized. This parameter controls the resolution of produced images. Higher DPI results in superior image quality but may increase the output file size. Default value is 288.
member.example: Consider a document of dimensions 3x4 inches. Using a DPI value of 300, the final image resolution translates to 900x1200 pixels.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.MergedDocument.UseOriginalPageNumbers
member.summary: Documents maintain their own page numbers upon merging, without continuity between them. As a result, APIs related to page numbers reflect individual documents, not the cumulative count. All documents are simply be merged together.
member.example: Merging a two-page document with a three-page document results in a sequence: 1, 2, 1, 2, 3.

member.name: M:QuestPDF.Infrastructure.MergedDocument.UseContinuousPageNumbers
member.summary: Consolidates the content from every document, creating a continuous seamless one. Page number APIs return a consecutive numbering for this unified document.
member.example: Merging a two-page document with a three-page document results in a sequence: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Settings.EnableCaching
member.summary: This flag generates additional document elements to cache layout calculation results. In the vast majority of cases, this significantly improves performance, while slightly increasing memory consumption.
member.remarks: By default, this flag is enabled only when the debugger is NOT attached.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Settings.EnableDebugging
member.summary: This flag generates additional document elements to improve layout debugging experience. When the provided content contains size constraints impossible to meet, the library generates special visual annotations to help determining the root cause.
member.remarks: By default, this flag is enabled only when the debugger IS attached.

member.name: P:QuestPDF.Settings.CheckIfAllTextGlyphsAreAvailable
member.summary: This flag enables checking the font glyph availability. If your text contains glyphs that are not present in the specified font, 1) when this flag is enabled: the DocumentDrawingException is thrown. OR 2) when this flag is disabled: placeholder characters are visible in the produced PDF file. Enabling this flag may slightly decrease document generation performance. However, it provides hints that used fonts are not sufficient to produce correct results.
member.remarks: By default, this flag is enabled only when the debugger IS attached.
